title: i'm in need of a tutor
body:
hey i'm in need of a tutor. i have majority of things down but i'm still pretty bad at the game to be honest (i tend to die too often/soon and i can barely jungle) i was wondering if anyone would be willing to help me out please

thank you for your time

replies.body: what kind of hero do you play most often??

Volibear is my safe pick i would say if i dont know what i want to play or just dont feel like having a hard game just because im so used to his mechanics and stuff i could probably play him blind folded

but in lanes its:
TOP - Volibear/Xin Zhao
JNG - Volibear - ive only played jng a few times but last game i did was really good i feel 
MID - Galio/Kayle - not so much kayle anymore havent played her since last season and i would say Ziggs but his sorta crap atm
ADC - Miss fortune - yeah i really need to get a better adc pool, i sort of only play her adc and i dont know why i just sort of haven't tried others  
SUP - Sona/Blitzcrank/Volibear - i play them equally as much

and for lanes/positions im most comfortable in it would be TOP and SUP. TOP lane easily has my biggest champ pool and sup because it feels like i have the least pressure on me in that roll, unlike with jng i feel like if i slip up ive just lost us the game

well i guess if you don't mind taking suggestion from another newbie (me...
i used to die alot too, but at the moment my over all win rate is about 56%? 
well it's not great... but i've been dying alot lately

from that list u gave, seems like you mostly use melee (or semi-melee like Kayle)chars?
i guess since melee is always up and close, chance of dying is very high
suppose u just need to know when to back off?
i only play ADC and support, with ADC i used to try and chase
or stick around not rtb when low hp, and got ganked or what ever

also knowing your enemy's skill helps i guess? 
like against Blitz, took me a while to remember his grabing range and speed and such
so now when i face him, or similar grabing hero (like treash) i die a lot less
same with other champs, if you know their skill, you will have a rough idea on how to deal with them

someone once told me that
"for one game, don't worry about killing, try just not to die"
the way he discribe to me is that, 
"everytime u die, that another 20% income toward another major item for the enemy
it does not help your team in anyway what so ever, 
and, it's worse then you not lv up enough or don't have enough income
so, just don't die"
I'm fine to help people who want it. Just add Lord Kylar Alice if anyone wants.

I'm happy to give you run you through some games, but I see you've played about 300 games total. You'll get better either way, just keep if you just keep playing.

My best suggestions is decide what aspect of the game you think you're lacking skill in:

- Objective understanding
- General mechanics
- Creed scoring
- When to play safe and when to be aggressive
- Team coordination
- Specific champion mechanics

Then just play a few games focussing on that aspect.

If you want me to watch or play with you and give you real-time tips, then just add me as a friend. 

Summoner name: Tweak
